navigator-xr-attribute.name: xr
navigator-xr-attribute.summary: The read-only xr property provided by the Navigator or WorkerNavigator interface returns an XRSystem object which can be used to access the WebXR Device API.
navigator-xr-attribute.title: Navigator.xr

dom-webglrenderingcontextbase-makexrcomp.name: makeXRCompatible
dom-webglrenderingcontextbase-makexrcomp.summary: The WebGLRenderingContext method makeXRCompatible() ensures that the rendering context described by the WebGLRenderingContext is ready to render the scene for the immersive WebXR device on which it will be displayed. If necessary, the WebGL layer may reconfigure the context to be ready to render to a different device than it originally was.
dom-webglrenderingcontextbase-makexrcomp.title: WebGLRenderingContext.makeXRCompatible()

dom-xrboundedreferencespace-boundsgeomet.name: boundsGeometry
dom-xrboundedreferencespace-boundsgeomet.summary: The read-only XRBoundedReferenceSpace property boundsGeometry is an array of DOMPointReadOnly objects which specifies the points making up a polygon inside which the viewer is allowed to move.
dom-xrboundedreferencespace-boundsgeomet.title: XRBoundedReferenceSpace.boundsGeometry

xrboundedreferencespace-interface.name: XRBoundedReferenceSpace
xrboundedreferencespace-interface.summary: The WebXR Device API's XRBoundedReferenceSpace interface describes a virtual world reference space which has preset boundaries. This extends XRReferenceSpace, which describes an essentially unrestricted space around the viewer's position.
xrboundedreferencespace-interface.title: XRBoundedReferenceSpace

enumdef-xreye.name: XREye
enumdef-xreye.summary: The XREye enumerated type is used to identify which eye a particular XRView represents: left or right; or, if the view doesn't represent a single eye, the value may be none.
enumdef-xreye.title: XREye

dom-xrframe-getpose.name: getPose
dom-xrframe-getpose.summary: The XRFrame method getPose() returns the relative position and orientation—the pose—of one XRSpace to that of another space.
dom-xrframe-getpose.title: XRFrame.getPose()

dom-xrframe-getviewerpose.name: getViewerPose
dom-xrframe-getviewerpose.summary: The getViewerPose() method, a member of the XRFrame interface, returns a XRViewerPose object which describes the viewer's pose (position and orientation) relative to the specified reference space.
dom-xrframe-getviewerpose.title: XRFrame.getViewerPose()

dom-xrframe-session.name: session
dom-xrframe-session.summary: An XRFrame object's read-only session property returns the XRSession object that generated the frame.
dom-xrframe-session.title: XRFrame.session

xrframe-interface.name: XRFrame
xrframe-interface.summary: A WebXR Device API XRFrame object is passed into the requestAnimationFrame() callback function and provides access to the information needed in order to render a single frame of animation for an XRSession describing a VR or AR sccene.
xrframe-interface.title: XRFrame

callbackdef-xrframerequestcallback.name: XRFrameRequestCallback
callbackdef-xrframerequestcallback.summary: The XRFrameRequestCallback is a callback function passed into XRSession.requestAnimationFrame (part of WebXR API) to obtain the current time and the current XRFrame.
callbackdef-xrframerequestcallback.title: XRFrameRequestCallback

dom-xrinputsource-gripspace.name: gripSpace
dom-xrinputsource-gripspace.summary: The read-only XRInputSource property gripSpace returns an XRSpace whose native origin tracks the pose used to render virtual objects so they appear to be held in (or part of) the user's hand.
dom-xrinputsource-gripspace.title: XRInputSource.gripSpace

dom-xrinputsource-handedness.name: handedness
dom-xrinputsource-handedness.summary: The read-only XRInputSource property handedness indicates which of the user's hands the WebXR input source is associated with, or if it's not associated with a hand at all.
dom-xrinputsource-handedness.title: XRInputSource.handedness

dom-xrinputsource-profiles.name: profiles
dom-xrinputsource-profiles.summary: The read-only XRInputSource property profiles returns an array of strings, each describing a configuration profile for the input source.
dom-xrinputsource-profiles.title: XRInputSource.profiles

dom-xrinputsource-targetraymode.name: targetRayMode
dom-xrinputsource-targetraymode.summary: The read-only XRInputSource property targetRayMode indicates the method by which the target ray for the input source should be generated and how it should be presented to the user.
dom-xrinputsource-targetraymode.title: XRInputSource.targetRayMode

dom-xrinputsource-targetrayspace.name: targetRaySpace
dom-xrinputsource-targetrayspace.summary: The read-only XRInputSource property targetRaySpace returns an XRSpace (typically an XRReferenceSpace) representing the position and orientation of the target ray in the virtual space.
dom-xrinputsource-targetrayspace.title: XRInputSource.targetRaySpace

xrinputsource-interface.name: XRInputSource
xrinputsource-interface.summary: The WebXR Device API's XRInputSource interface describes a single source of control input which is part of the user's WebXR-compatible virtual or augmented reality system.
xrinputsource-interface.title: XRInputSource

xrinputsourcearray.name: entries
xrinputsourcearray.summary: The XRInputSourceArray interface's entries() method returns a JavaScript iterator which can then be used to iterate over the key/value pairs in the input source array.
xrinputsourcearray.title: XRInputSourceArray.entries()

xrinputsourcearray.name: forEach
xrinputsourcearray.summary: The XRInputSourceArray method forEach() executes the specified callback once for each input source in the array, starting at index 0 and progressing until the end of the list.
xrinputsourcearray.title: XRInputSourceArray.forEach()

xrinputsourcearray.name: keys
xrinputsourcearray.summary: The keys() method in the XRInputSourceArray interface returns a JavaScript iterator which can then be used to iterate over the keys used to reference each item in the array of input sources.
xrinputsourcearray.title: XRInputSourceArray.keys()

xrinputsourcearray.name: values
xrinputsourcearray.summary: The XRInputSourceArray method  values() returns a JavaScript iterator that can walk over the list of XRInputSource objects contained in the array, from first to last.
xrinputsourcearray.title: XRInputSourceArray.values()

dom-xrinputsourcearray-length.name: length
dom-xrinputsourcearray-length.summary: The read-only length property returns an integer value indicating the number of items in the input source list represented by the XRInputSourceArray object.
dom-xrinputsourcearray-length.title: XRInputSourceArray.length

xrinputsourcearray-interface.name: XRInputSourceArray
xrinputsourcearray-interface.summary: The interface XRInputSourceArray represents a live list of WebXR input sources, and is used as the return value of the XRSession property inputSources.
xrinputsourcearray-interface.title: XRInputSourceArray

xrinputsourceevent.name: XRInputSourceEvent
xrinputsourceevent.summary: The XRInputSourceEvent() constructor creates and returns a new XRInputSourceEvent object describing an event (state change) which has occurred on a WebXR user input device represented by an XRInputSource.
xrinputsourceevent.title: XRInputSourceEvent()

xrinputsourceevent.name: XRInputSourceEvent
xrinputsourceevent.summary: The WebXR Device API's XRInputSourceEvent interface describes an event which has occurred on a WebXR user input device such as a hand controller, gaze tracking system, or motion tracking system.
xrinputsourceevent.title: XRInputSourceEvent

dom-xrinputsourceevent-frame.name: frame
dom-xrinputsourceevent-frame.summary: The read-only XRInputSourceEvent property frame specifies an XRFrame object representing the event frame during which a WebXR user input occurred.
dom-xrinputsourceevent-frame.title: XRInputSourceEvent.frame

dom-xrinputsourceevent-inputsource.name: inputSource
dom-xrinputsourceevent-inputsource.summary: The XRInputSourceEvent interface's read-only inputSource property specifies the XRInputSource which generated the input event.
dom-xrinputsourceevent-inputsource.title: XRInputSourceEvent.inputSource

dom-xrinputsourceschangeevent-xrinputsou.name: XRInputSourcesChangeEvent
dom-xrinputsourceschangeevent-xrinputsou.summary: The XRInputSourcesChangeEvent() constructor creates and returns a new XRInputSourcesChangeEvent object, representing an update to the list of available WebXR input devices.
dom-xrinputsourceschangeevent-xrinputsou.title: XRInputSourcesChangeEvent()

dom-xrinputsourceschangeevent-added.name: added
dom-xrinputsourceschangeevent-added.summary: The read-only XRInputSourcesChangeEvent property added is a list of zero or more input sources, each identified using an XRInputSource object, which have been newly made available for use.
dom-xrinputsourceschangeevent-added.title: XRInputSourcesChangeEvent.added

dom-xrinputsourceschangeevent-removed.name: removed
dom-xrinputsourceschangeevent-removed.summary: The read-only XRInputSourcesChangeEvent property removed is an array of zero or more XRInputSource objects representing the input sources which have been removed from the XRSession.
dom-xrinputsourceschangeevent-removed.title: XRInputSourcesChangeEvent.removed

dom-xrinputsourceschangeevent-session.name: session
dom-xrinputsourceschangeevent-session.summary: The XRInputSourcesChangeEvent property session specifies the XRSession to which the input source list change event applies.
dom-xrinputsourceschangeevent-session.title: XRInputSourcesChangeEvent.session

xrinputsourceschangeevent.name: XRInputSourcesChangeEvent
xrinputsourceschangeevent.summary: The WebXR Device API interface XRInputSourcesChangeEvent is used to represent the inputsourceschange event sent to an XRSession when the set of available WebXR input controllers changes.
xrinputsourceschangeevent.title: XRInputSourcesChangeEvent

dom-xrpermissiondescriptor-mode.name: mode
dom-xrpermissiondescriptor-mode.summary: The mode property of the XRPermissionDescriptor dictionary is a string taken from the XRSessionMode enumerated type, specifying which Web XR session mode (inline, immersive-vr, or immersive-ar) the described permissions will be used for.
dom-xrpermissiondescriptor-mode.title: XRPermissionDescriptor.mode

dom-xrpermissiondescriptor-optionalfeatu.name: optionalFeatures
dom-xrpermissiondescriptor-optionalfeatu.summary: The XRPermissionDescriptor dictionary's optionalFeatures property is used to specify a list of WebXR features which your app or site would like to use but can operate without if permission isn't granted to use them.
dom-xrpermissiondescriptor-optionalfeatu.title: XRPermissionDescriptor.optionalFeatures

dom-xrpermissiondescriptor-requiredfeatu.name: requiredFeatures
dom-xrpermissiondescriptor-requiredfeatu.summary: The XRPermissionDescriptor dictionary's requiredFeatures property should be set prior to calling navigator.permissions.query() to a list of WebXR features which must be supported for the app to work.
dom-xrpermissiondescriptor-requiredfeatu.title: XRPermissionDescriptor.requiredFeatures

dictdef-xrpermissiondescriptor.name: XRPermissionDescriptor
dictdef-xrpermissiondescriptor.summary: User permissions in the WebXR Device API are managed using the Permissions API. To that end, the XRPermissionDescriptor dictionary is used to describe the WebXR features the app needs to use, as well as those features it would like ot use if permision is granted.
dictdef-xrpermissiondescriptor.title: XRPermissionDescriptor

dom-xrpermissionstatus-granted.name: granted
dom-xrpermissionstatus-granted.summary: The WebXR Device API's XRPermissionStatus interface's granted property is an array of strings, each identifying one of the WebXR features for which permission has been granted as of the time at which the Permission API's navigator.permissions.query() method was called.
dom-xrpermissionstatus-granted.title: XRPermissionStatus.granted

xrpermissionstatus.name: XRPermissionStatus
xrpermissionstatus.summary: The XRPermissionStatus interface defines the object returned by calling navigator.permissions.query() for the xr permission name; it indicates whether or not the app or site has permission to use WebXR, an may be monitored over time for changes to that permissions tate.
xrpermissionstatus.title: XRPermissionStatus

dom-xrpose-emulatedposition.name: emulatedPosition
dom-xrpose-emulatedposition.summary: The emulatedPosition read-only attribute of the XRPose interface is a Boolean value indicating whether or not both the the position component of the pose's transform is directly taken from the XR device, or it's simulated or computed based on other sources.
dom-xrpose-emulatedposition.title: XRPose.emulatedPosition

dom-xrpose-transform.name: transform
dom-xrpose-transform.summary: The transform read-only attribute of the XRPose interface is a XRRigidTransform object providing the position and orientation of the pose relative to the base XRSpace as specified when the pose was obtained by calling XRFrame.getPose().
dom-xrpose-transform.title: XRPose.transform

xrpose-interface.name: XRPose
xrpose-interface.summary: XRPose is a WebXR API interface representing a position and orientation in the 3D space, relative to the XRSpace within which it resides.
xrpose-interface.title: XRPose

dom-xrreferencespace-getoffsetreferences.name: getOffsetReferenceSpace
dom-xrreferencespace-getoffsetreferences.summary: The XRReferenceSpace interface's getOffsetReferenceSpace() method returns a new reference space object which describes the relative difference in position between the object on which the method is called and a given point in 3D space.
dom-xrreferencespace-getoffsetreferences.title: XRReferenceSpace.getOffsetReferenceSpace()

dom-xrreferencespace-onreset.name: onreset
dom-xrreferencespace-onreset.summary: The XRReferenceSpace interface's onreset event handler property can be set to a function which is called when the XRReferenceSpace receives a reset event, signaling that the  XR device has experienced a discontinuity large enough to require that the position and/or orientation of the origin be significantly altered to compensate.
dom-xrreferencespace-onreset.title: XRReferenceSpace.onreset

eventdef-xrreferencespace-reset.name: reset_event
eventdef-xrreferencespace-reset.summary: The reset event is sent to an XRReferenceSpace object when a discontinuity is detected in either the native origin or the effective origin, causing a jump in the position or orientation of objects oriented using the reference space.
eventdef-xrreferencespace-reset.title: XRReferenceSpace: reset event

xrreferencespace-interface.name: XRReferenceSpace
xrreferencespace-interface.summary: The WebXR Device API's XRReferenceSpace interface describes the coordinate system for a specific tracked entity or object within the virtual world using a specified tracking behavior.
xrreferencespace-interface.title: XRReferenceSpace

dom-xrreferencespaceevent-xrreferencespa.name: XRReferenceSpaceEvent
dom-xrreferencespaceevent-xrreferencespa.summary: The XRReferenceSpaceEvent() constructor is used to create a new XRReferenceSpaceEvent object, which represents an event regarding the state of a WebXR reference space object, XRReferenceSpace.
dom-xrreferencespaceevent-xrreferencespa.title: XRReferenceSpaceEvent()

dom-xrreferencespaceevent-referencespace.name: referenceSpace
dom-xrreferencespaceevent-referencespace.summary: The read-only XRReferenceSpaceEvent property referenceSpace specifies the reference space which is the originator of the event.
dom-xrreferencespaceevent-referencespace.title: XRReferenceSpaceEvent.referenceSpace

dom-xrreferencespaceevent-transform.name: transform
dom-xrreferencespaceevent-transform.summary: The read-only XRReferenceSpaceEvent property transform indicates the position and orientation of the affected referenceSpace's native origin after the changes the event represents are applied.
dom-xrreferencespaceevent-transform.title: XRReferenceSpaceEvent.transform

xrreferencespaceevent.name: XRReferenceSpaceEvent
xrreferencespaceevent.summary: The WebXR Device API interface XRReferenceSpaceEvent represents an event sent to an XRReferenceSpace. Currently, the only event  that uses this type is the reset event.
xrreferencespaceevent.title: XRReferenceSpaceEvent

dom-xrrigidtransform-xrrigidtransform.name: XRRigidTransform
dom-xrrigidtransform-xrrigidtransform.summary: The XRRigidTransform() constructor creates and returns a new XRRigidTransform object, representing the position and orientation of a point or object.
dom-xrrigidtransform-xrrigidtransform.title: XRRigidTransform()

dom-xrrigidtransform-inverse.name: inverse
dom-xrrigidtransform-inverse.summary: The read-only inverse property of the XRRigidTransform interface returns another XRRigidTransform object which is the inverse of its owning transform.
dom-xrrigidtransform-inverse.title: XRRigidTransform.inverse

dom-xrrigidtransform-matrix.name: matrix
dom-xrrigidtransform-matrix.summary: The read-only XRRigidTransform property matrix returns the transform matrix represented by the object. The returned matrix can then be premultiplied with a column vector to rotate the vector by the 3D rotation specified by the orientation, then translate it by the position.
dom-xrrigidtransform-matrix.title: XRRigidTransform.matrix

dom-xrrigidtransform-orientation.name: orientation
dom-xrrigidtransform-orientation.summary: The read-only XRRigidTransform property orientation is a DOMPointReadOnly containing a normalized quaternion (also called a unit quaternion or versor) specifying the rotational component of the transform represented by the object.
dom-xrrigidtransform-orientation.title: XRRigidTransform.orientation

dom-xrrigidtransform-position.name: position
dom-xrrigidtransform-position.summary: The read-only XRRigidTransform property position is a DOMPointReadOnly object which provides the 3D point, specified in meters, describing the translation component of the transform.
dom-xrrigidtransform-position.title: XRRigidTransform.position

xrrigidtransform-interface.name: XRRigidTransform
xrrigidtransform-interface.summary: The XRRigidTransform is a WebXR API interface that represents the 3D geometric transform described by a position and orientation.
xrrigidtransform-interface.title: XRRigidTransform

dom-xrsession-cancelanimationframe.name: cancelAnimationFrame
dom-xrsession-cancelanimationframe.summary: The cancelAnimationFrame() method of the XRSession interface cancels an animation frame which was previously requested by calling requestAnimationFrame.
dom-xrsession-cancelanimationframe.title: XRSession.cancelAnimationFrame()

dom-xrsession-end.name: end
dom-xrsession-end.summary: The end() method shuts down the XRSession on which it's called, returning a promise which resolves once the session has fully shut down.
dom-xrsession-end.title: XRSession.end()

eventdef-xrsession-end.name: end_event
eventdef-xrsession-end.summary: An end event is fired at an XRSession object when the WebXR session has ended, either because the web application has chosen to stop the session, or because the user agent terminated the session.
eventdef-xrsession-end.title: XRSession: end event

dom-xrsession-inputsources.name: inputSources
dom-xrsession-inputsources.summary: The read-only inputSources property of the XRSession interface returns an XRInputSourceArray object which lists all controllers and input devices which are expressly associated with the XR device and are currently available.
dom-xrsession-inputsources.title: XRSession.inputSources

eventdef-xrsession-inputsourceschange.name: inputsourceschange_event
eventdef-xrsession-inputsourceschange.summary: The inputsourceschange event is sent to an XRSession when the set of available WebXR input devices changes.
eventdef-xrsession-inputsourceschange.title: XRSession: inputsourceschange event

dom-xrsession-onend.name: onend
dom-xrsession-onend.summary: The onend attribute of the XRSession object is the event handler for the end event, which is dispatched after the XR session ends and all related hardware-specific routines are completed.
dom-xrsession-onend.title: XRSession.onend

dom-xrsession-oninputsourceschange.name: oninputsourceschange
dom-xrsession-oninputsourceschange.summary: The oninputsourcechange attribute of the XRSession object is the event handler for the inputsourcechange event, which is dispatched when session's list of active XR input sources has changed. The list itself is accessible via XRSession.inputSources.
dom-xrsession-oninputsourceschange.title: XRSession.oninputsourceschange

dom-xrsession-onselect.name: onselect
dom-xrsession-onselect.summary: The onselect property of the XRSession object is the event handler for the select event, which is dispatched when a primary action is completed successfully by the user.
dom-xrsession-onselect.title: XRSession.onselect

dom-xrsession-onselectend.name: onselectend
dom-xrsession-onselectend.summary: The onselectend attribute of the XRSession object is the event handler for the selectend event, which is dispatched when user finishes making some sort of selection by releasing a trigger, touchpad, or button, finishes speaking a command, or makes a hand gesture. For example, this might include releasing a button or joystick.
dom-xrsession-onselectend.title: XRSession.onselectend

dom-xrsession-onselectstart.name: onselectstart
dom-xrsession-onselectstart.summary: The onselectstart attribute of the XRSession object is the event handler for the selectstart event, which is dispatched when user starts making some sort of selection by pressing a trigger, touchpad, or button, speaking a command, or making a hand gesture. For example, this might include pressing a button or moving a joystick.
dom-xrsession-onselectstart.title: XRSession.onselectstart

dom-xrsession-onvisibilitychange.name: onvisibilitychange
dom-xrsession-onvisibilitychange.summary: The onvisibilitychange attribute of the XRSession object is the event handler for the visibilitychange event, which is dispatched when the visibility state of the XR session changes. The visibility state of the session is accessible via XRSession.visibilityState.
dom-xrsession-onvisibilitychange.title: XRSession.onvisibilitychange

dom-xrsession-renderstate.name: renderState
dom-xrsession-renderstate.summary: The read-only renderState property of an XRSession object indicates the returns a XRRenderState object describing how the user's environment which should be rendered.
dom-xrsession-renderstate.title: XRSession.renderState

dom-xrsession-requestanimationframe.name: requestAnimationFrame
dom-xrsession-requestanimationframe.summary: The XRSession method requestAnimationFrame(), much like the Window method of the same name, schedules a callback to be executed the next time the browser is ready to paint the session's virtual environment to the XR display.
dom-xrsession-requestanimationframe.title: XRSession.requestAnimationFrame()

dom-xrsession-requestreferencespace.name: requestReferenceSpace
dom-xrsession-requestreferencespace.summary: The requestReferenceSpace() method of the XRSession interface returns a promise that resolves with an instance of either XRReferenceSpace or XRBoundedReferenceSpace as appropriate given the type of reference space requested.
dom-xrsession-requestreferencespace.title: XRSession.requestReferenceSpace()

eventdef-xrsession-select.name: select_event
eventdef-xrsession-select.summary: The WebXR event select is sent to an XRSession when one of the session's input sources has completed a primary action.
eventdef-xrsession-select.title: XRSession: select event

eventdef-xrsession-selectend.name: selectend_event
eventdef-xrsession-selectend.summary: The WebXR event selectend is sent to an XRSession when one of its input sources ends its primary action or when an input source that's in the process of handling an ongoing primary action is disconnected without successfully completing the action.
eventdef-xrsession-selectend.title: XRSession: selectend event

eventdef-xrsession-selectstart.name: selectstart_event
eventdef-xrsession-selectstart.summary: The WebXR event selectstart is sent to an XRSession when the user begins a primary action on one of its input sources.
eventdef-xrsession-selectstart.title: XRSession: selectstart event

dom-xrsession-updaterenderstate.name: updateRenderState
dom-xrsession-updaterenderstate.summary: The updateRenderState() method of the XRSession interface of WebXR API schedules changes to be applied to the active render state prior to rendering of the next frame.
dom-xrsession-updaterenderstate.title: XRSession.updateRenderState()

eventdef-xrsession-visibilitychange.name: visibilitychange_event
eventdef-xrsession-visibilitychange.summary: The visibilitychange event is sent to an XRSession to inform it when it becomes visible or hidden, or when it becomes visible but not currently focused.
eventdef-xrsession-visibilitychange.title: XRSession: visibilitychange event

dom-xrsession-visibilitystate.name: visibilityState
dom-xrsession-visibilitystate.summary: The read-only visibilityState property of the XRSession interface is a string indicating whether the WebXR content is currently visible to the user, and if it is, whether it's the primary focus.
dom-xrsession-visibilitystate.title: XRSession.visibilityState

xrsession-interface.name: XRSession
xrsession-interface.summary: The WebXR Device API's XRSession interface represents an ongoing XR session, providing methods and properties used to interact with and control the session. To open a WebXR session, use the XRSystem interface's requestSession() method.
xrsession-interface.title: XRSession

dom-xrsessionevent-xrsessionevent.name: XRSessionEvent
dom-xrsessionevent-xrsessionevent.summary: The WebXR Device API's XRSessionEvent() constructor creates and returns a new XRSessionEvent object.
dom-xrsessionevent-xrsessionevent.title: XRSessionEvent()

dom-xrsessionevent-session.name: session
dom-xrsessionevent-session.summary: The read-only XRSessionEvent interface's session property indicates which XRSession the event is about.
dom-xrsessionevent-session.title: XRSessionEvent.session

xrsessionevent.name: XRSessionEvent
xrsessionevent.summary: The WebXR Device API's XRSessionEvent interface describes an event which indicates the change of the state of an XRSession.
xrsessionevent.title: XRSessionEvent

xrsessionmode-enum.name: XRSessionMode
xrsessionmode-enum.summary: The WebXR Device API's XRSessionMode enumerated type defines the string values used to identify the possible kinds of session mode that can be used.
xrsessionmode-enum.title: XRSessionMode

xrspace-interface.name: XRSpace
xrspace-interface.summary: The XRSpace interface of the WebXR Device API is an abstract interface providing a common basis for every class which represents a virtual coordinate system within the virtual world, in which its origin corresponds to a physical location.
xrspace-interface.title: XRSpace

eventdef-xrsystem-devicechange.name: devicechange_event
eventdef-xrsystem-devicechange.summary: A devicechange event is fired on an XRSystem object whenever the whenever the availability of immersive XR devices has changed; for example, a VR headset or AR goggles have been connected or disconnected.
eventdef-xrsystem-devicechange.title: XRSystem: devicechange event

dom-xrsystem-issessionsupported.name: isSessionSupported
dom-xrsystem-issessionsupported.summary: The XRSystem method isSessionSupported() returns a promise which resolves to true if the specified WebXR session mode is supported by the user's WebXR device. Otherwise, the promise resolves with false.
dom-xrsystem-issessionsupported.title: XRSystem: isSessionSupported()

dom-xrsystem-ondevicechange.name: ondevicechange
dom-xrsystem-ondevicechange.summary: The ondevicechange property of the XRSystem interface is passed a devicechange event whenever availability of an immersive device changes. The event that is fired is a "simple event" that implements the Event interface.
dom-xrsystem-ondevicechange.title: XRSystem: ondevicechange

dom-xrsystem-requestsession.name: requestSession
dom-xrsystem-requestsession.summary: The XRSystem interface's requestSession() method returns a promise which resolves to an XRSession object through which you can manage the requested type of WebXR session.
dom-xrsystem-requestsession.title: XRSystem: requestSession()

xrsystem-interface.name: XRSystem
xrsystem-interface.summary: The WebXR Device API interface XRSystem provides methods which let you get access to an XRSession object representing a WebXR session. With that XRSession in hand, you can use it to interact with the Augmented Reality (AR) or Virtual Reality (VR) device.
xrsystem-interface.title: XRSystem

dom-xrview-eye.name: eye
dom-xrview-eye.summary: The XRView interface's read-only eye property is a string taken from the XREye enumerated type, indicating which eye's viewpoint the XRView represents: left or right. For views which represent neither eye, such as monoscopic views, this property's value is none.
dom-xrview-eye.title: XRView.eye

dom-xrview-projectionmatrix.name: projectionMatrix
dom-xrview-projectionmatrix.summary: The XRView interface's read-only projectionMatrix property specifies the projection matrix to apply to the underlying view. This should be used to integrate perspective to everything in the scene, in order to ensure the result is consistent with what the eye expects to see.
dom-xrview-projectionmatrix.title: XRView.projectionMatrix

dom-xrview-transform.name: transform
dom-xrview-transform.summary: The read-only transform property of the XRView interface is an XRRigidTransform object which provides the position and orientation of the viewpoint relative to the XRReferenceSpace specified when the XRFrame.getViewerPose() method was called to obtain the view object.
dom-xrview-transform.title: XRView.transform

xrview-interface.name: XRView
xrview-interface.summary: The WebXR Device API's XRView interface provides information describing a single view into the XR scene for a specific frame, providing orientation and position information for the viewpoint.
xrview-interface.title: XRView

dom-xrviewerpose-views.name: views
dom-xrviewerpose-views.summary: The read-only XRViewerPose property views returns an array which contains every XRView which must be rendered in order to fully represent the scene from the viewpoint defined by the viewer pose. For monoscopic devices, this array contains a single view.
dom-xrviewerpose-views.title: XRViewerPose.views

xrviewerpose-interface.name: XRViewerPose
xrviewerpose-interface.summary: The WebXR Device API interface XRViewerPose represents the pose (the position and orientation) of a viewer's point of view on the scene. Each XRViewerPose can have multiple views to represent, for example, the slight separation between the left and right eye.
xrviewerpose-interface.title: XRViewerPose

dom-xrviewport-height.name: height
dom-xrviewport-height.summary: The read-only XRViewport property height specifies the height, in pixels, of the viewport onto the drawing surface within which the WebXR view is to be rendered.
dom-xrviewport-height.title: XRViewport.height

dom-xrviewport-width.name: width
dom-xrviewport-width.summary: The read-only XRViewport property width specifies the width of the viewport, in pixels, onto the drawing surface the 3D scene is to be rendered into.
dom-xrviewport-width.title: XRViewport.width

dom-xrviewport-x.name: x
dom-xrviewport-x.summary: The read-only XRViewport interface's x property indicates the offset from the left edge of the destination surface (typically a XRWebGLLayer to the left edge of the viewport within the surface into which WebXR content is to be rendered.
dom-xrviewport-x.title: XRViewport.x

dom-xrviewport-y.name: y
dom-xrviewport-y.summary: The read-only XRViewport interface's y property indicates the offset from the bottom edge of the destination surface (typically a XRWebGLLayer to the bottom edge of the viewport within the surface into which WebXR content is to be rendered.
dom-xrviewport-y.title: XRViewport.y

xrviewport-interface.name: XRViewport
xrviewport-interface.summary: The WebXR Device API's XRViewport interface provides properties used to describe the size and position of the current viewport within the XRWebGLLayer being used to render the 3D scene.
xrviewport-interface.title: XRViewport

dom-xrwebgllayer-xrwebgllayer.name: XRWebGLLayer
dom-xrwebgllayer-xrwebgllayer.summary: The WebXR Device API XRWebGLLayer() constructor creates and returns a new XRWebGLLayer object, providing the linkage between the WebXR device and the WebGL graphics layer used to render the 3D scene.
dom-xrwebgllayer-xrwebgllayer.title: XRWebGLLayer()

dom-xrwebgllayer-antialias.name: antialias
dom-xrwebgllayer-antialias.summary: The read-only XRWebGLLayer property antialias is a Boolean value which is true if the rendering layer's frame buffer supports antialiasing.
dom-xrwebgllayer-antialias.title: XRWebGLLayer.antialias

dom-xrwebgllayer-framebuffer.name: framebuffer
dom-xrwebgllayer-framebuffer.summary: The read-only XRWebGLLayer property framebuffer is an opaque WebGLFramebuffer which is used to buffer the rendered image if the XR compositor is being used. Otherwise, this property's value is null.
dom-xrwebgllayer-framebuffer.title: XRWebGLLayer.framebuffer

dom-xrwebgllayer-framebufferheight.name: framebufferHeight
dom-xrwebgllayer-framebufferheight.summary: The read-only XRWebGLLayer property framebufferHeight indicates the height of the framebuffer, in pixels.
dom-xrwebgllayer-framebufferheight.title: XRWebGLLayer.framebufferHeight

dom-xrwebgllayer-framebufferwidth.name: framebufferWidth
dom-xrwebgllayer-framebufferwidth.summary: The read-only XRWebGLLayer property framebufferWidth specifies the width of the framebuffer, in pixels.
dom-xrwebgllayer-framebufferwidth.title: XRWebGLLayer.framebufferWidth

dom-xrwebgllayer-getnativeframebuffersca.name: getNativeFramebufferScaleFactor
dom-xrwebgllayer-getnativeframebuffersca.summary: The static method XRWebGLLayer.getNativeFramebufferScaleFactor() returns a floating-point scaling factor by which one can multiply the specified XRSession's resolution to get the native resolution of the WebXR device's frame buffer.
dom-xrwebgllayer-getnativeframebuffersca.title: XRWebGLLayer.getNativeFramebufferScaleFactor() static method

dom-xrwebgllayer-getviewport.name: getViewport
dom-xrwebgllayer-getviewport.summary: The XRWebGLLayer interface's getViewport() method returns the XRViewport that should be used to render the specified XRView into the WebGL layer.
dom-xrwebgllayer-getviewport.title: XRWebGLLayer.getViewport()

dom-xrwebgllayer-ignoredepthvalues.name: ignoreDepthValues
dom-xrwebgllayer-ignoredepthvalues.summary: The read-only XRWebGLLayer property ignoreDepthValues is a Boolean value which is true if the session has been configured to ignore the values in the depth buffer while rendering the scene. If the depth buffer is being used to determine the position of vertices, this property is false.
dom-xrwebgllayer-ignoredepthvalues.title: XRWebGLLayer.ignoreDepthValues

xrwebgllayer-interface.name: XRWebGLLayer
xrwebgllayer-interface.summary: The XRWebGLLayer interface of the WebXR Device API provides a linkage between the WebXR device (or simulated XR device, in the case of an inline session) and a WebGL context used to render the scene for display on the device.
xrwebgllayer-interface.title: XRWebGLLayer

dom-xrwebgllayerinit-alpha.name: alpha
dom-xrwebgllayerinit-alpha.summary: The alpha property is a Boolean value which, if present and set to true in the XRWebGLLayerInit dictionary passed into the XRWebGLLayer() constructor, specifies that the new layer's color buffer is to include an alpha channel.
dom-xrwebgllayerinit-alpha.title: XRWebGLLayerInit.alpha

dom-xrwebgllayerinit-antialias.name: antialias
dom-xrwebgllayerinit-antialias.summary: The Boolean antialias property, if present and set to true in the XRWebGLLayerInit object provided as the XRWebGLLayer() constructor's layerInit parameter, requests that the new WebGL rendering layer support anti-aliasing. If this property is missing or is false, anti-aliasing is not desired.
dom-xrwebgllayerinit-antialias.title: XRWebGLLayerInit.antialias

dom-xrwebgllayerinit-depth.name: depth
dom-xrwebgllayerinit-depth.summary: When using the XRWebGLLayer() constructor to create a new WebGL rendering layer for WebXR, providing as the layerInit parameter an object whose depth property is false will request that the new layer be created without a depth buffer.
dom-xrwebgllayerinit-depth.title: XRWebGLLayerInit.depth

dom-xrwebgllayerinit-framebufferscalefac.name: framebufferScaleFactor
dom-xrwebgllayerinit-framebufferscalefac.summary: The XRWebGLLayerInit dictionary's framebufferScaleFactor property, when specified upon instantiating a new XRWebGLLayer using its constructor, XRWebGLLayer(), specifies the scaling factor to use when determining the size of the frame buffer to use when rendering the scene, relative to the default XR device display resolution.
dom-xrwebgllayerinit-framebufferscalefac.title: XRWebGLLayerInit.framebufferScaleFactor

dom-xrwebgllayerinit-ignoredepthvalues.name: ignoreDepthValues
dom-xrwebgllayerinit-ignoredepthvalues.summary: The XRWebGLLayerInit dictionary's Boolean ignoreDepthValues property can be provided in the options passed into the XRWebGLLayer() constructor to indicate that the depth buffer, if it exists, should be ignored while composing the scene.
dom-xrwebgllayerinit-ignoredepthvalues.title: XRWebGLLayerInit.ignoreDepthValues

dom-xrwebgllayerinit-stencil.name: stencil
dom-xrwebgllayerinit-stencil.summary: When using the XRWebGLLayer() constructor to create a new WebGL rendering layer for WebXR, providing as the layerInit parameter an object whose stencil property is false requests that the new layer be created without a stencil buffer.
dom-xrwebgllayerinit-stencil.title: XRWebGLLayerInit.stencil

dictdef-xrwebgllayerinit.name: XRWebGLLayerInit
dictdef-xrwebgllayerinit.summary: The WebXR Device API's XRWebGLLayerInit dictionary is used to provide configuration options when creating a new XRWebGLLayer object with the XRWebGLLayer() constructor.
dictdef-xrwebgllayerinit.title: XRWebGLLayerInit

permissions-policy.name: xr-spatial-tracking
permissions-policy.summary: The HTTP Feature-Policy header xr-spatial-tracking directive controls whether the current document is allowed to use the WebXR Device API. This policy controls whether navigator.xr.requestSession() can return XRSession that requires spatial tracking and whether user agent can indicate support for sessions supporting spatial tracking via navigator.xr.isSessionSupported() and devicechange event on navigator.xr object.
permissions-policy.title: Feature-Policy: xr-spatial-tracking
